title: 1.3 Billion Muslims Do Not Have The Freedom To Change Belief. Why?
description: In 12 countries conversion from Islam and blasphemy is criminalised and punishable by death. In 12 other countries conversion from Islam and blasphemy is criminalised and punished by one or several of the following: jail sentence, torture, loos of child custody and marriage annulment.
extendedDescription:
This is in breach of Article 18 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. 

In 12 countries (Afghanistan, Brunei, Iran, Kuwait, Maldives, Mauritania, N.Sudan, Pakistan, Qatar, SaudiArabia, Somalia and Yemen) conversion from Islam and blasphemy is criminalised and punishable by death.

In 12 other countries(Algeria, Bahrain, Comoro Islands, Egypt, Jordan, Libya, Malaysia, Morocco and Western Sahara, Oman, Syria, United Arab Emirates and Uzbekistan)  conversion from Islam and blasphemy is criminalised and punished by and one or several of the following: jail sentence, torture, loos of child custody and marriage annulment. 
Article 18
Everyone has the right to freedom of thought, conscience and religion; this right includes freedom to change his religion or belief, and freedom, either alone or in community with others and in public or private, to manifest his religion or belief in teaching, practice, worship and observance.

Evenemanget tolkas till svenska.
